title: I have read and seen lots of Agatha Christie. Why was Poirot a Belgian vs. a French detective? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hercule Poirot makes his first appearance in the novel 'The Mysterious Affair at Styles', which was written in the heat of the First World War, only to be published later on. In the story, Poirot appears as a Belgian detective who is obliged to leave his country and emigrate to Great Britain.

Agatha Christie made her fictional detective a Belgian as she began writing during World War I. Belgium had been attacked, and many Belgian refugees had come to England. Ms. Christie had met some of them, and was inspired by them to create her detective as a Belgian refugee: indeed, he first appears as a Belgian refugee in The Mysterious Affair at Styles as an acquaintance of his soon to be sidekick Arthur Hastings.
